text: Ragunan Zoo is a 140-hectare (350-acre) zoo in Pasar Minggu, South Jakarta, Indonesia. It was founded in 1864. The zoo has over 295 species of animals, 171 species of floraDina Indrasafitri, 'Ragunan zoo: Not so rosy', The Jakarta Post, 5 October 2010. and 3,122 animal specimens including birds. Ragunan Zoo is a combination of a zoo and park, so it is also known as Ragunan Zoological Park.Indonesia Travel Guide . Retrieved on 8 December 2011. It holds a lot of Indonesian species such as komodo dragon, orangutan, tapir, anoa, sumatran tiger, Javan Hawk-eagle and various colored birds like the southern cassowary. Other popular animals are sumatran elephant, kangaroo, giraffe, and zebra. ==References== == Other websites == Category:Zoos Category:Buildings and structures in Indonesia Category:Organizations based in Indonesia
title: Ragunan Zoo
